item.title: Streaming to twitch with NDI and FFmpeg
item.description: My girlfriend has recently been streaming pubg on twitch, she asked me to set everything up for her so of course I had to overcomplicate it. What is NDI? NDI is a standard designed for low latency video feeds over a network. Why is this useful? Well streaming to services such as Twitch requires a decent amount of processing power due to the encoding required. NDI is an almost “lossless” stream meaning that we can offload the processing to a second “streaming” PC leaving more CPU for playing games which is especially useful for games such as Pubg that are very CPU demanding.
